subject: lamptest: Add virtual LEDs to group definition
commitMessage:
lamptest: Add virtual LEDs to group definition

- During LampTest, if a physical LED state has to be changed, the
  requirement is that we apply the states after the lamp test is
  done. However, there is another requirement that expects the
  accurate state of LEDs to be reported. virtual physical LEDs
  solves this problem.

- If the lamp test is not running, state of virtual_led will be equal
  to real physical LED. However, during LampTest, virtual LED would
  indicate the effective state of the LED as if there was no lamp
  test. Once the lamp test finishes, state of virtual and physical
  would be same.

Signed-off-by: George Liu <liuxiwei@inspur.com>
Change-Id: I9489228725577d942dd469312e871c2ee712cd33

Should we add any header ?.. like say : skip_list or something .. Well, it's obvious from the name of the json. So, I believe, it's fine

But could we add these members one below the other ?. so, it becomes easier to extend this
Done

Is there anyway we can add a comment to this JSON on what the entries in json represent ?

As in : 

<!--
This json contains name of physical leds that will get triggered during lamp test overriding lamp-test requirements

these will be hosted as /xyz/openbmc_project/led/physical/<$name_in_this_file>
-->
Ack
Agreed, I don't understand what this and the next JSON file are used for.

lamp-test-force-update.json: As mentioned above, it contains the physical LEDs that need to be triggered during the lamp test.

For example: 
all physical LEDs will be set to "On" when starting the lamp test, and then it will last for a period of time (default is 4 minutes). 
At this time, if we need to set the `enclosure` physical LEDs status(On->Off/On->Blink), At this time, only the status information will be saved but not updated. 
If users want to know the current status of the enclosure, we can only get "On" instead of "Off/Blink".
So we need to add this JSON configuration file to force the state of the `enclosure` physical LEDs to be updated.

lamp-test-skip-update.json: Contrary to the above, it contains physical LEDs that need to be skipped during the lamp test.
And same comment here
Ack
so from now on, every LED group will have an extra virtual LED group of itself?  Is there a way for the code to handle this without needing extra JSON?

> so from now on, every LED group will have an extra virtual LED group of itself?  

Yeah
If users need to enable `use-lamp-test`, the virtual LED group needs to be expanded, otherwise, it can be ignored.

> Is there a way for the code to handle this without needing extra JSON?

Since this JSON is loaded once when the `phosphor-led-manager` starts, I think JSON needs to be extended.
Please let me know if you have a better way, Thanks.

Hi Matt, led-group-config.json is a group definition for all FRUs and enclosures. Now, the "virtual_enclosure_fault" that is mentioned here is a "virtual physical led" and is not a group itself. This "virtual_enclosure_fault" is to be treated as "any other physical LED". In reality, virtual_enclosure_fault will always be equal to physical enclosure fault indicators. However, during lamp test, we have a need that we have to communicate the actual status of physical LED _without_ actually turning on physical LEDs and this is resolved by "virtual physical led".

The 2 extra JSONs, "force" and "skip" are provided here to give flexibility for users to configure. If you don't want to have that, you can just get going without force.json and skip.json.
Why was this comment removed ?. Please put the comment here.
Ack
please put the comment here.
Ack
"This section of this json contains ....."
Done
